summary:
The Nordic countries are a group of nations in Northern Europe and the North Atlantic. They include Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway, Sweden, and some autonomous regions. These countries share similar cultures, history, and social models. They have a history of trying to unite politically but are now independent.

The Nordic region is known for its high standards of living, good education, and strong economies. The people here have a mix of different ethnic backgrounds, and most speak North Germanic languages. The main religion is Lutheran Christianity. The Nordic countries work together through the Nordic Council and the Nordic Council of Ministers.
title: Nordic countries
